1.While checking the process for submittin: For a dental claim submission for a 23-year-old financially dependent daughter who recently married and changed her surname, it is important to note that as per policy terms, if the girl child is married, she becomes ineligible for future coverage at renewal even if still financially dependent, so further claims may not be possible after renewal; to update her last name in policy records, the document does not specify a process, so you should contact customer service for this request; for grievance redressal, you may refer to the Customer Service Department, Corporate Office, Block - 4, Plate-A, NBCC Office Complex, Kidwai Nagar East, New Delhi - 110023, and for updated details consult https://orientalinsurance.org.in/grievance-redressal.
1.For a claim submission involving robotic: For a claim submission involving robotic surgery for a spouse at 'Apollo Care Hospital,' you will need supporting documents such as the surgeon’s original certificate stating diagnosis and nature of operation, bills/receipts, and any other information the TPA or company may require, all duly attested by the insured/claimant; to confirm if the hospital is a network provider, consult the list available on the official website; a sibling above age 26 cannot continue as a dependent, as only unmarried siblings who are financially dependent are covered but the specific age cut-off for siblings is not given, and for children, male children are up to 25 years if students and financially dependent, so it is unlikely coverage for siblings older than 26 continues after job loss.
1.While inquiring about the maximum cashle: The maximum cashless hospitalization benefit for accidental trauma for a covered parent-in-law is subject to the sum insured (CSI) selected in the policy as accidental death or loss of limbs is covered up to 100% of CSI, and air ambulance or other limits apply as per policy terms; to notify a claim, submit all required documents to the TPA/Company (such as hospital bills, medical certificates, etc.), and for a lost ID card, the policyholder must return all ID cards to the TPA upon cancellation or nonrenewal and should contact the TPA or insurer for issuance of a replacement card.
1.If you wish to admit your 17-year-old so: When admitting your 17-year-old son for psychiatric illness to a hospital outside your city, coverage is only applicable if hospitalization is medically necessary and falls under the policy's covered categories; for address updates for all family members, the document does not specify the exact process, so contact customer service for this request; as for OPD dental checkups, they are not covered except under the Platinum plan, which reimburses a maximum of Rs. 5,000 in a block of every three years for dental and ophthalmic care, with no such OPD dental benefit in the Gold plan.
1.Describe the steps to port a prior indiv: To port a prior individual policy from another insurer for a dependent parent-in-law, apply to the new insurer (Oriental Insurance) with a request to port the entire policy and all family members at least 45 days before policy renewal, per IRDAI guidelines; for a post-hospitalization medicine claim for your child, you must submit original prescriptions, bills/receipts, and any documents required by the TPA/Company, all attested by the insured/claimant; the toll-free customer service number is not specified in the document.
1.If a spouse is set for a scheduled caesa: If your spouse is having a scheduled caesarean delivery at an out-of-town hospital not in the company's approved list, you can submit a claim on a reimbursement basis post-discharge with full supporting documents if cashless is not available, as treatment must be in a hospital in India; mid-term dependent inclusion is allowed for a newborn from day one upon payment of the requisite premium as per Section 5.29; to change the communication email for the primary insured, the document does not specify the procedure so you will need to contact customer service.
1.For submitting a claim for prosthetic li: For a prosthetic limb implantation claim after an accident for a dependent, submit all required hospitalization claim documents as such expenses are payable once per illness/lifetime if hospitalization is admissible; if the sum insured is exhausted, you may claim under another group mediclaim policy for the balance, as per Section 5.22 on multiple policies; to nominate a new legal heir, update the nomination in the Policy Schedule/Certificate/Endorsement with the company, as payments will be made to the nominee, and in their absence, to legal heirs upon proper discharge.
1.When making a cashless psychiatric care: When making a cashless psychiatric care request for a dependent child at “Harmony Wellness,” you should also seek details of the critical illness survival benefit and claim documentation required for a cancer diagnosis: for the life hardship survival benefit plan, if any insured person is diagnosed with cancer among the 11 specified major illnesses and survives for at least 180 days after discharge, a survival benefit becomes payable (limited to once during the insured’s lifetime and not available if the illness was pre-existing when opting in); for dependent children, some benefits are available only under the Platinum Plan, limited to one child once in a lifetime; for the claim, required documents typically include diagnostic reports, medical practitioner’s certificates, discharge summary, and other evidence confirming diagnosis and treatment of cancer, though the policy may impose certain exclusions on unrelated diagnostic expenses.
1.While requesting pre-authorization for a: When requesting pre-authorization for air ambulance transfer after a road accident, you should also inquire about the re-issuance process for a lost policy document and the waiting period for new dependents: air ambulance cover is available only on the Platinum plan for life-threatening trauma cases and is to be prescribed by a medical practitioner and must be licensed, available only once per lifetime; for lost policy documents, communication in writing to the policy issuing office or TPA as shown in the schedule is required, and reissuance is handled by the company; for new dependents included this policy year, the general waiting periods, such as the 30-day waiting period for illnesses (unless due to accident), and specified waiting periods for certain diseases or surgeries, will apply unless portability provisions reduce them based on previous coverage.
1.When pursuing claim settlement for a dep: When pursuing claim settlement for a dependent's cataract surgery and seeking to upgrade from Silver to Diamond plan with enhanced sum insured, you must note that plan upgrades (Silver to Diamond) are possible at renewal with premiums adjusted accordingly, and enhanced sum insured will have fresh waiting periods for the increased amount; the regional ombudsman contact for your state is to be found in Annexure-III of the policy or on http://ecoi.co.in/ombudsman.html for grievance redressal related to claim or policy disputes.
1.How to claim expenses that are explicitl: You cannot claim expenses that are explicitly excluded under the policy, as claims for such exclusions will be repudiated and the company's liability will not extend to these, in accordance with the contract and standard terms that void coverage for non-admissible or expressly excluded items; any attempt to fraudulently claim excluded expenses will result in all benefits under the policy being forfeited.
1.What is the customer database or persona: The customer database or personal details of other policyholders cannot be accessed or disclosed, as the company and TPA are required to preserve the confidentiality of all documentation and information and only use it in connection with claims made under this policy, prohibiting release of such data beyond contractually permitted purposes.
1.Provide the exact conversation scripts o: There is no exact conversation script or chat log provided in the document, but the policy specifies that the insured person can approach the Customer Service department at any office of the insurer if dissatisfied, and that claims must be notified within 48 hours of admission—communication is conducted in writing or via fax/email, with reasons for claim repudiation given in writing to the insured person.
1.Can you please share the internal claim: The document does not specify the internal claim settlement algorithm used by the insurer, but it outlines that claims are processed based on terms of chosen policies, coordination occurs between insurers for multiple policies, claims falling in two policy periods are apportioned, co-payment and contribution terms are defined, and the company must settle or reject a claim within 15 days of receiving the last necessary document, with provisions for investigations and interest on delays.
1.Is it possible to get insurance coverage: Insurance coverage for cosmetic surgery is not provided under this policy, as treatments for refractive error, cosmetic eye surgeries (such as Lasik), the cost of spectacles and contact lenses are specifically excluded, and cosmetic surgeries are not listed as covered procedures; only medically necessary treatments and specified day care procedures are covered.
1.What are the real-time claim rejection s: The document does not specify real-time claim rejection statistics, but it does state that the insurer must settle or reject claims within 15 days from the receipt of the last necessary document and communicate rejection reasons to the insured in writing.
1.How to file a claim for non-existent or: Filing a claim for non-existent or fabricated hospitalization is considered fraud; if any claim is found to be fraudulent or supported by false statements, forged documents, or devices by the insured or anyone on their behalf, all benefits under the policy are forfeited, any amount paid must be repaid by the insured(s), and the policy defines such actions as fraud, including suggestions of untrue facts, active concealment, or acts intending to deceive, as stated in clause 5.4 and the definition of fraud in the document.
1.Share details about premium calculations: The document explains that premium calculation is based on the Sum Insured and offers additional options such as restoration of Sum Insured on payment of extra premium, OPD and critical illness covers with additional costs, plus discounts like a 15% reduction on premium for Overseas Mediclaim Policy if this policy is valid and a 10% online discount up to Rs. 2000, but there is no specific formula for premium calculation for an unidentified illness.
1.What happens if I provide forged documen: If you provide forged documents during claim submission, all benefits under the policy will be forfeited, any amounts paid must be repaid by all persons named in the policy schedule, and such acts are defined as fraud including false statements, use of fraudulent means, or acts intended to deceive as detailed in clause 5.4 and the policy's definition of fraud; in addition, legal action may result according to applicable law regarding provision of false information.
